page.title: 09 The first Council Estate
page.content: North Hull Estate is fifty years old, and it shows. Sameness is even more evident than on Orchard Park. If there are twelve house patterns on Orchard Park Estate, there are only six on the North Hull Estate. But fashions change and a huge advantage for North Hull was the vogue for building very low density housing during dthe 1930s. The great spin-off was huge front and back gardens. People were not pressed close together in their living space. Could this just be the reason for limited spoiling graffiti? Perhaps it is more simply the lack of spatial opportunity as there are no "wall hordings" to to match the High School gymnasia; there are no secluded underpasses; and there is no single large shopping centre to match the Orchard Park Centre. On the other hand the degree of social deprivation is the same.
